A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
(Contains some SPOILERS)
It's beautifully crafted and acted. It looks and sounds amazing. The characters are (mostly) interesting and relatable\, leading to the film having a lot of emotional weight. There are some controversial plot points. It might be a little too long\, and a certain "side-quest" sequence in the middle falls a  little flat.
However\, the film is very unpredictable and therefore thrilling. A lot of fans seem to think that it's too unpredictable\, and that it strives too far from what Star Wars should be in their opinion. The film takes a lot of risks\, which is refreshing\, after Episode 7 didn't bring much new to the table story-wise. 
A lot of Star Wars fans seem to only like "surprises" when they can see them coming. The Last Jedi doesn't bring much fan service. In fact\, Rian Johnson was not interested in fan theories about Rey\, Snoke etc. (and why should he be?). I don't think it's legit criticism if you're mad that the story didn't go the way you wanted it to go.
It's apparent however\, that there wasn't really a single vision for these films. Johnson doesn't pick up on certain points that were set up in Episode 7. Sometimes\, these choices work (would it have been shocking to anyone if Rey turned out to be another Skywalker\, or even a Kenobi or something?)\, at other times it might feel unsatisfying.
The Last Jedi is risky\, and not all of it works. But it's refreshing\, ambitous\, bold and beautiful.
